articles.author: MICHAEL R. SISAK, JAKE OFFENHARTZ, PHILIP MARCELO and ALANNA DURKIN RICHER
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Hope Hicks, a former adviser to Donald Trump, took the stand Friday at the former president's hush money trial and recounted how his 2016 campaign became embroiled in a political firestorm over a recording in which he boasted about grabbing women without their permission.
articles.title: Hope Hicks, ex-Trump adviser, recounts political firestorm in 2016 over 'Access Hollywood' tape

articles.author: KAREN MATTHEWS, MICHAEL HILL, JULIE WATSON and CHRISTOPHER L. KELLER
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Police ordered pro-Palestinian protesters to abandon a tent encampment at New York University early Friday, following weeks of demonstrations and police crackdowns at college campuses nationwide that have resulted in more than 2,300 arrests.
articles.title: Arrests of Israel-Hamas war protesters exceed 2,300 as police clear more US campus encampments

articles.author: PAUL WISEMAN and ANNE D'INNOCENZIO
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The nation’s employers pulled back on their hiring in April but still added a decent 175,000 jobs in a sign that persistently high interest rates may be starting to slow the robust U.S.
articles.title: US employers scaled back hiring in April. How that could let the Fed cut interest rates

articles.author: TARA COPP
articles.description: EDWARDS AIR FORCE BASE, Calif. (AP) — With the midday sun blazing, an experimental orange and white F-16 fighter jet launched with a familiar roar that is a hallmark of U.S. airpower. But the aerial combat that followed was unlike any other: This F-16 was controlled by artificial intelligence, not a human pilot.
articles.title: An AI-controlled fighter jet took the Air Force leader for a historic ride. What that means for war

articles.author: JUAN A. LOZANO and LEKAN OYEKANMI
articles.description: HOUSTON (AP) — Officials in Southeast Texas, including the Houston area, on Friday urged residents to prepare for worsening flooding after days of heavy rains that have led to high-water rescues and mandatory evacuation orders.
articles.title: Heavy rains over Texas have led to water rescues, school cancellations and orders to evacuate

articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Democratic U.S. Rep. Henry Cuellar of Texas denied any wrongdoing amid reports of pending indictments related to the former Soviet republic of Azerbaijan.The longtime congressman released a statement Friday saying he and his wife “are innocent of these allegations.”
articles.title: US Rep. Henry Cuellar of Texas denies wrongdoing amid reports of pending indictment

articles.author: ANITA SNOW and MORGAN LEE
articles.description: PHOENIX (AP) — Arizona Gov. Katie Hobbs' signing of the repeal of a Civil War-era ban on nearly all abortions was a stirring occasion for the women working to ensure that the 19th century law remains in the past.
articles.title: Arizona governor's signing of abortion law repeal follows political fight by women lawmakers

articles.author: MICHELLE L. PRICE and JILL COLVIN
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — He's visiting Manhattan construction sites, decrying local crime and holding court in his gilded Fifth Avenue penthouse.After a years-long breakup with his hometown, Donald Trump is back in New York, this time as a criminal defendant.
articles.title: New York made Donald Trump and could convict him. But for now, he's using it to campaign

articles.author: MICHAEL KUNZELMAN and ALANNA DURKIN RICHER
articles.description: A former government employee has been charged with repeatedly submitting fake tips to the FBI reporting that several of his co-workers in the intelligence community were part of a mob that attacked the U.S.
articles.title: Ex-government employee charged with falsely accusing co-workers of joining Capitol riot

articles.author: BETH HARRIS
articles.description: LOUISVILLE, Ky. (AP) — If Larry Demeritte is looking for a positive sign heading into his first Kentucky Derby as a trainer, it's right where his horse is assigned.
articles.title: Larry Demeritte is just the second Black trainer since 1951 to saddle a horse for the Kentucky Derby
